channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024100340
item.description:
Report E-2024100340

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-11
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XTM experienced a UN3266 PI-2100 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of product released to a 15’ x 20’ area of the concrete dock floor. Prior to their arrival, XPO placed wood chips and absorbents down to contain the release. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents, wood chips, cleanup debris, and the impacted pallet were containerized into 2 flex bins and (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Report E-2024100330

  • City: STURTEVANT
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6580
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, a cover came off the pump. This allowed approximately 20 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Clean Harbors responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024100285
item.description:
Report E-2024100285

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 1, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3077 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately sixteen (16) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EXE) to remediate the site. EXE personnel utilized a vacuum unit to remediate the UN3077-impacted trailer. The unaffected freight was restacked and rewrapped onsite for future terminal use. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.
